common

Class RationalNumber

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Number
      • common.RationalNumber
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class RationalNumber
extends java.lang.Number
    This class represents a rational number, typically used in the TIFF/EXIF image format. TIFF rational numbers are defined as pairs of 32-bit integers, encompassing numerator and denominator. This class stores the numerator and denominator as 64-bit long integers to safely handle 32-bit unsigned inputs from TIFF/EXIF specifications. All instances are automatically normalised (reduced to the lowest terms with a positive divisor) upon creation to ensure mathematical equality and consistent hash codes.
    Since:
    27 November 2025
    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    Trevor Maggs
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • RationalNumber

        private RationalNumber(long num,
                       long div,
                       RationalNumber.DataType type,
                       boolean normalise)
        The core private constructor used by all public constructors and the simplify method to create new RationalNumber instances.

        This method performs two key steps before assignment:

        1. Sign Normalisation: Ensures the divisor is always positive by moving the sign to the numerator if necessary (e.g., -1 / -2 becomes 1 / 2).
        2. Reduction (Simplification): Optionally reduces the fraction to its lowest terms using the greatest common divisor (GCD) if the normalise flag is true.
        Parameters:
        num - the input numerator (64-bit long)
        div - the input divisor (64-bit long)
        type - the original data type interpretation (SIGNED or UNSIGNED)
        normalise - if true, the fraction will be fully reduced (simplified) via GCD
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArithmeticException - if the divisor is zero and the numerator is non-zero

      • RationalNumber

        public RationalNumber(int num,
                      int div,
                      RationalNumber.DataType type)
        Constructs an instance to handle both signed and unsigned 32-bit integers. The input values are masked to 64-bit longs if DataType.UNSIGNED is specified. The resulting rational number is normalised (reduced).
        Parameters:
        num - a numerator in either 32-bit signed or unsigned format.
        div - a non-zero divisor in either 32-bit signed or unsigned format
        type - specifies whether the values should be interpreted as DataType.UNSIGNED or DataType.SIGNED

      • RationalNumber

        public RationalNumber(int num,
                      int div)
        Constructs a signed instance, interpreting inputs as standard 32-bit signed integers. The resulting rational number is normalised (reduced).
        Parameters:
        num - a numerator in 32-bit signed format
        div - a non-zero divisor in 32-bit signed format

    • Method Detail

      • simplify

        public static RationalNumber simplify(long numerator,
                                      long divisor,
                                      RationalNumber.DataType type)
        Simplifies or reduces a fraction by finding the greatest common divisor (GCD). Note, it calls the private normalising constructor to obtain a simplified fraction.
        Parameters:
        numerator - the top number of the fraction
        divisor - the bottom number of the fraction
        type - a flag indicating the type for the resulting instance
        Returns:
        An instance of the RationalNumber class, representing the simplified fraction

      • negate

        public RationalNumber negate()
        Returns a new instance with the value negated (multiplied by -1). The resulting instance is always treated as SIGNED, and the fraction is normalised. Basically, it negates the numerator and simplifies to ensure the divisor remains positive.
        Returns:
        a valid instance with a negated value

      • intValue

        public int intValue()
        Returns the integer representation of the rational number. It performs the conversion by dividing the numerator by the denominator and truncating the result toward zero. Note that this operation may result in a loss of precision.
        Specified by:
        intValue in class java.lang.Number
        Returns:
        the integer value after computation (truncated)

      • longValue

        public long longValue()
        Returns the long representation of the rational number. It performs the conversion by dividing the numerator by the denominator and truncating the result toward zero. Note that this operation may result in a loss of precision.
        Specified by:
        longValue in class java.lang.Number
        Returns:
        the long value after computation (truncated)

      • floatValue

        public float floatValue()
        Returns the single-precision floating-point representation of the rational number. It obtains a double-precision value during computation to maintain as much precision from the original numerator and denominator as possible before casting to float.
        Specified by:
        floatValue in class java.lang.Number
        Returns:
        the floating-point value after computation

        the double value after computation

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Compares this rational number to the specified object. The comparison is based on the mathematically normalised state (reduced numerator and positive divisor). Two RationalNumber instances are considered equal if their normalised numerator, normalised divisor, and unsignedType flag are identical.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        obj - the object to compare against
        Returns:
        true if the specified object is mathematically equal to this rational number and shares the same data type interpretation, false otherwise

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Returns the hash code for this rational number. The hash code is generated from the normalised numerator, normalised divisor, and the unsignedType flag. This ensures that mathematically equal rational numbers, for example: 1/2 and 2/4, have the same hash code.
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a hash code value for this object.

      • hasIntegerValue

        public boolean hasIntegerValue()
        Checks if the rational number represents a whole number (an integer value).
        Returns:
        true if the division results in a whole number, false otherwise.

      • toSimpleString

        public java.lang.String toSimpleString(boolean decimalAllowed)
        Returns the string representation of the rational number, favouring a simple integer if the value is a whole number.
        Parameters:
        decimalAllowed - if true, allows a short decimal representation (e.g., "0.5") for simple fractions
        Returns:
        the simple string representation

      • gcd

        private static long gcd(long a,
                        long b)
        Computes the greatest common divisor in a recursive fashion, based on the Euclidean algorithm.
        Parameters:
        a - the first number
        b - the second number
        Returns:
        the greatest common divisor of a and b

      • getFraction

        private double getFraction()
        Computes and returns the rational number as a double-precision floating-point value.
        Returns:
        the floating-point result of numerator divided by divisor
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArithmeticException - if the divisor is zero
